instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the wguide1 opcode for simple waveguide synthesis
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; wguide1 opcode: ares wguide1 asig, xfreq, kcutoff, kfeedback
    ; wguide1 implements a simple waveguide with one delay line
    ; asig - input signal (excitation)
    ; xfreq - frequency in Hz (sets delay line length)
    ; kcutoff - lowpass filter cutoff frequency
    ; kfeedback - feedback amount (0-1, <1 for stability)
    
    ; Impulse excitation
    aExcite mpulse 0.5, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    kCutoff = 3000
    kFeedback = 0.95
    
    ; Simple waveguide
    aWave wguide1 aExcite, iFreq, kCutoff, kFeedback
    
    outs aWave, aWave
endin

instr 2
    ; String-like sound with high feedback
    aExcite mpulse 0.4, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    kCutoff = 4000
    kFeedback = 0.98    ; Very high feedback for long sustain
    
    aWave wguide1 aExcite, iFreq, kCutoff, kFeedback
    
    outs aWave, aWave
endin

instr 3
    ; Darker tone with low cutoff
    aExcite mpulse 0.5, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    kCutoff = 1500      ; Lower cutoff for darker sound
    kFeedback = 0.95
    
    aWave wguide1 aExcite, iFreq, kCutoff, kFeedback
    
    outs aWave, aWave
endin

instr 4
    ; Short decay with lower feedback
    aExcite mpulse 0.6, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    kCutoff = 3000
    kFeedback = 0.85    ; Lower feedback for shorter decay
    
    aWave wguide1 aExcite, iFreq, kCutoff, kFeedback
    
    outs aWave, aWave
endin

instr 5
    ; Noise excitation for bowed effect
    aNoise noise 0.02, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    kCutoff = 3500
    kFeedback = 0.99    ; Very high feedback
    
    aWave wguide1 aNoise, iFreq, kCutoff, kFeedback
    
    outs aWave*0.8, aWave*0.8
endin

instr 6
    ; Frequency glide
    aExcite mpulse 0.5, 0
    
    iStart = p4
    iEnd = p5
    
    ; Smooth frequency glide
    kFreq expseg iStart, p3, iEnd
    
    kCutoff = 3000
    kFeedback = 0.96
    
    aWave wguide1 aExcite, kFreq, kCutoff, kFeedback
    
    outs aWave, aWave
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play basic waveguide
i1 0 3 440
i1 3.5 3 330

; Play long sustain
i2 7.5 4 523

; Play dark tone
i3 12.5 3 294

; Play short decay
i4 16.5 2 392
i4 18.5 2 440

; Play bowed effect
i5 21.5 4 220

; Play frequency glide
; Format: start dur freq_start freq_end
i6 26.5 2 220 440
i6 28.5 2 440 220

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the wguide2 opcode for bidirectional waveguide synthesis
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; wguide2 opcode: ares wguide2 asig, xfreq, kcutoff1, kcutoff2, kfeedback1, kfeedback2
    ; wguide2 implements a bidirectional waveguide with two delay lines
    ; asig - input signal (excitation)
    ; xfreq - frequency in Hz
    ; kcutoff1 - lowpass cutoff for forward direction
    ; kcutoff2 - lowpass cutoff for backward direction
    ; kfeedback1 - feedback for forward direction (0-1)
    ; kfeedback2 - feedback for backward direction (0-1)
    
    ; Impulse excitation
    aExcite mpulse 0.5, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    kCut1 = 3000
    kCut2 = 3000
    kFdbk1 = 0.95
    kFdbk2 = 0.95
    
    ; Bidirectional waveguide
    aWave wguide2 aExcite, iFreq, kCut1, kCut2, kFdbk1, kFdbk2
    
    outs aWave, aWave
endin

instr 2
    ; Asymmetric filtering (different cutoffs)
    aExcite mpulse 0.4, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    kCut1 = 4000        ; Brighter forward
    kCut2 = 2000        ; Darker backward
    kFdbk1 = 0.96
    kFdbk2 = 0.96
    
    aWave wguide2 aExcite, iFreq, kCut1, kCut2, kFdbk1, kFdbk2
    
    outs aWave, aWave
endin

instr 3
    ; Asymmetric feedback (different decay rates)
    aExcite mpulse 0.5, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    kCut1 = 3000
    kCut2 = 3000
    kFdbk1 = 0.98       ; Longer decay forward
    kFdbk2 = 0.90       ; Shorter decay backward
    
    aWave wguide2 aExcite, iFreq, kCut1, kCut2, kFdbk1, kFdbk2
    
    outs aWave, aWave
endin

instr 4
    ; Dynamic filtering
    aExcite mpulse 0.5, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Cutoffs change over time
    kCut1 linseg 5000, p3, 1500
    kCut2 linseg 2000, p3, 4000
    
    kFdbk1 = 0.95
    kFdbk2 = 0.95
    
    aWave wguide2 aExcite, iFreq, kCut1, kCut2, kFdbk1, kFdbk2
    
    outs aWave, aWave
endin

instr 5
    ; Realistic string with dispersion
    aExcite mpulse 0.4, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Slightly different parameters for dispersion
    kCut1 = 3500
    kCut2 = 3200
    kFdbk1 = 0.97
    kFdbk2 = 0.96
    
    aWave wguide2 aExcite, iFreq, kCut1, kCut2, kFdbk1, kFdbk2
    
    outs aWave, aWave
endin

instr 6
    ; Continuous excitation (bowed)
    aNoise noise 0.015, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    kCut1 = 3500
    kCut2 = 3500
    kFdbk1 = 0.99
    kFdbk2 = 0.99
    
    aWave wguide2 aNoise, iFreq, kCut1, kCut2, kFdbk1, kFdbk2
    
    outs aWave*0.7, aWave*0.7
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play basic bidirectional
i1 0 3 440
i1 3.5 3 523

; Play asymmetric filtering
i2 7.5 3 330

; Play asymmetric feedback
i3 11.5 3 392

; Play dynamic filtering
i4 15.5 4 294

; Play realistic string
i5 20.5 3 220
i5 23.5 3 247

; Play bowed effect
i6 27.5 4 165

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the wterrain opcode for wave-terrain synthesis
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function tables for wave-terrain
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1
giSaw ftgen 2, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0.5, 0.3, 0.25, 0.2, 0.16, 0.14, 0.12
giSquare ftgen 3, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0, 0.3, 0, 0.2, 0, 0.14, 0, 0.11
giTri ftgen 4, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0, -0.11, 0, 0.04, 0, -0.02

instr 1
    ; wterrain opcode: ares wterrain kamp, kpch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, ktab0, ktab1, ktab2, ktab3
    ; wterrain implements wave-terrain synthesis
    ; kamp - amplitude
    ; kpch - pitch in Hz
    ; kx, ky - orbit center coordinates (-1 to 1)
    ; krx, kry - orbit radii
    ; krot - rotation speed
    ; ktab0, ktab1, ktab2, ktab3 - four table numbers for terrain
    
    kAmp = 0.4
    kPch = p4
    
    ; Circular orbit at center
    kx = 0
    ky = 0
    krx = 0.5
    kry = 0.5
    krot = 1
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

instr 2
    ; Elliptical orbit
    kAmp = 0.4
    kPch = p4
    
    kx = 0
    ky = 0
    krx = 0.7       ; Wider horizontal
    kry = 0.3       ; Narrower vertical
    krot = 1
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

instr 3
    ; Off-center orbit
    kAmp = 0.4
    kPch = p4
    
    kx = 0.3        ; Offset horizontally
    ky = -0.2       ; Offset vertically
    krx = 0.4
    kry = 0.4
    krot = 1
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

instr 4
    ; Variable rotation speed
    kAmp = 0.4
    kPch = p4
    
    kx = 0
    ky = 0
    krx = 0.5
    kry = 0.5
    
    ; Accelerating rotation
    krot linseg 0.5, p3, 2
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

instr 5
    ; Moving orbit center
    kAmp = 0.4
    kPch = p4
    
    ; LFO on orbit center
    kx oscili 0.5, 0.5, giSine
    ky oscili 0.5, 0.7, giSine, 0.25
    
    krx = 0.3
    kry = 0.3
    krot = 1
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

instr 6
    ; Morphing orbit size
    kAmp = 0.4
    kPch = p4
    
    kx = 0
    ky = 0
    
    ; Radii change over time
    krx linseg 0.1, p3*0.5, 0.8, p3*0.5, 0.2
    kry linseg 0.8, p3*0.5, 0.1, p3*0.5, 0.7
    
    krot = 1
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

instr 7
    ; Complex modulation
    kAmp = 0.4
    kPch = p4
    
    ; Multiple LFOs
    kx oscili 0.3, 0.3, giSine
    ky oscili 0.4, 0.5, giSine, 0.33
    
    krx oscili 0.3, 0.7, giSine
    krx = 0.4 + krx
    
    kry oscili 0.2, 0.9, giSine
    kry = 0.4 + kry
    
    krot = 1.5
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play basic circular orbit
i1 0 3 220
i1 3.5 3 330

; Play elliptical orbit
i2 7.5 3 440

; Play off-center orbit
i3 11.5 3 392

; Play variable rotation
i4 15.5 4 294

; Play moving orbit center
i5 20.5 4 523

; Play morphing orbit
i6 25.5 5 165

; Play complex modulation
i7 31.5 6 220

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates advanced waveguide techniques
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function tables
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; String ensemble using multiple wguide1
    aExcite mpulse 0.3, 0
    
    ; Root, fifth, octave
    iRoot = p4
    i5th = iRoot * 3/2
    i8ve = iRoot * 2
    
    ; Three waveguides slightly detuned
    aStr1 wguide1 aExcite, iRoot*0.998, 3000, 0.96
    aStr2 wguide1 aExcite, i5th, 3200, 0.97
    aStr3 wguide1 aExcite, i8ve*1.002, 3100, 0.96
    
    ; Stereo mix
    aLeft = aStr1*0.6 + aStr2*0.4 + aStr3*0.3
    aRight = aStr1*0.3 + aStr2*0.4 + aStr3*0.6
    
    outs aLeft, aRight
endin

instr 2
    ; Sympathetic resonance
    aExcite mpulse 0.4, 0
    
    iFund = p4
    
    ; Primary string
    aPrimary wguide2 aExcite, iFund, 3500, 3500, 0.97, 0.97
    
    ; Sympathetic strings (harmonics)
    aSym1 wguide1 aPrimary*0.3, iFund*2, 3000, 0.93
    aSym2 wguide1 aPrimary*0.2, iFund*3, 2800, 0.91
    aSym3 wguide1 aPrimary*0.15, iFund*4, 2600, 0.89
    
    ; Mix all
    aMix = aPrimary*0.6 + aSym1*0.2 + aSym2*0.1 + aSym3*0.1
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

instr 3
    ; Feedback loop between waveguides
    aExcite mpulse 0.35, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; First waveguide
    aWg1 wguide1 aExcite, iFreq, 3000, 0.94
    
    ; Second waveguide fed by first
    aWg2 wguide1 aWg1*0.4, iFreq*1.5, 3500, 0.93
    
    ; Third waveguide fed by second
    aWg3 wguide1 aWg2*0.3, iFreq*2, 4000, 0.92
    
    ; Mix
    aMix = aWg1*0.5 + aWg2*0.3 + aWg3*0.2
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

instr 4
    ; Plucked string with damping
    aExcite mpulse 0.4, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Cutoff decreases to simulate damping
    kCutoff linseg 5000, p3, 1200
    
    ; Feedback decreases
    kFeedback linseg 0.98, p3, 0.85
    
    aStr wguide2 aExcite, iFreq, kCutoff, kCutoff*0.9, kFeedback, kFeedback*0.98
    
    outs aStr, aStr
endin

instr 5
    ; Tremolo effect
    aExcite mpulse 0.4, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    
    aStr wguide1 aExcite, iFreq, 3000, 0.96
    
    ; Amplitude modulation
    kTrem oscili 0.4, 6, giSine
    kTrem = 0.6 + kTrem
    
    outs aStr*kTrem, aStr*kTrem
endin

instr 6
    ; Vibrato on waveguide
    aExcite mpulse 0.4, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Frequency modulation
    kVib oscili 8, 5, giSine
    kFreq = iFreq + kVib
    
    aStr wguide1 aExcite, kFreq, 3200, 0.97
    
    outs aStr, aStr
endin

instr 7
    ; Karplus-Strong with waveguides
    ; Noise burst excitation
    aNoise noise 0.5, 0
    aNoise = aNoise * (1 - linseg(0, 0.01, 1, 0.001, 1))
    
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Two directions for fuller sound
    aKS wguide2 aNoise, iFreq, 8000, 7500, 0.98, 0.97
    
    outs aKS, aKS
endin

instr 8
    ; Bow-table waveguide
    ; Continuous excitation with envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.1, 0.1, 0.7, 0.3
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.02, 0
    
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; High feedback for sustained tone
    aStr wguide2 aNoise, iFreq, 3500, 3200, 0.995, 0.994
    
    outs aStr*0.8, aStr*0.8
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play string ensemble
i1 0 3 220
i1 3.5 3 330

; Play sympathetic resonance
i2 7.5 4 196

; Play feedback loop
i3 12.5 3 294

; Play damped string
i4 16.5 3 392

; Play tremolo
i5 20.5 3 440

; Play vibrato
i6 24.5 3 523

; Play Karplus-Strong
i7 28.5 2 330
i7 30.5 2 440
i7 32.5 2 523

; Play bowed
i8 35.5 4 165

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates wave-terrain synthesis techniques and modulation
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function tables for wave-terrain
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1
giCos ftgen 2, 0, 8192, 11, 1
giSaw ftgen 3, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0.5, 0.3, 0.25, 0.2, 0.16, 0.14, 0.12
giSquare ftgen 4, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0, 0.3, 0, 0.2, 0, 0.14
giTri ftgen 5, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0, -0.11, 0, 0.04
giPulse ftgen 6, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 1, 1, 1, 0.7, 0.5, 0.3, 0.1

instr 1
    ; Timbral morphing with terrain
    kAmp = 0.35
    kPch = p4
    
    ; Orbit parameters morph
    kx linseg 0, p3, 0.5
    ky linseg 0, p3, -0.5
    
    krx = 0.5
    kry = 0.5
    krot = 1
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

instr 2
    ; Rhythmic terrain modulation
    kAmp = 0.35
    kPch = p4
    
    ; Pulsing orbit size
    kPulse lfo 0.3, 4, 1  ; Square wave
    krx = 0.3 + abs(kPulse)
    kry = 0.5
    
    kx = 0
    ky = 0
    krot = 1.5
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giCos, giSaw, giSquare
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

instr 3
    ; Chaotic terrain (multiple modulations)
    kAmp = 0.3
    kPch = p4
    
    ; Multiple LFOs at different rates
    kx oscili 0.4, 0.37, giSine
    ky oscili 0.5, 0.53, giCos
    
    krx oscili 0.25, 0.71, giSine
    krx = 0.35 + krx
    
    kry oscili 0.2, 0.89, giCos
    kry = 0.4 + kry
    
    krot oscili 0.8, 0.43, giSine
    krot = 1.2 + krot
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSaw, giSquare, giTri, giPulse
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

instr 4
    ; Stereo terrain (two instances panned)
    kAmp = 0.3
    kPch = p4
    
    ; Left channel terrain
    kxL oscili 0.4, 0.5, giSine
    kyL oscili 0.3, 0.7, giSine, 0.25
    
    aTerrL wterrain kAmp, kPch, kxL, kyL, 0.4, 0.4, 1, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    ; Right channel terrain (different modulation)
    kxR oscili 0.3, 0.6, giSine, 0.5
    kyR oscili 0.4, 0.8, giSine, 0.75
    
    aTerrR wterrain kAmp, kPch*1.002, kxR, kyR, 0.35, 0.45, 1.1, giCos, giSquare, giTri, giPulse
    
    outs aTerrL, aTerrR
endin

instr 5
    ; Pitch tracking terrain
    kAmp = 0.35
    
    ; Pitch changes
    iStart = p4
    iEnd = p5
    kPch expseg iStart, p3, iEnd
    
    ; Orbit size inversely related to pitch
    krx = 0.2 + (1 - kPch/iEnd) * 0.5
    kry = 0.2 + (1 - kPch/iEnd) * 0.5
    
    kx = 0
    ky = 0
    krot = 1
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    outs aTerr, aTerr
endin

instr 6
    ; Resonant terrain with feedback
    kAmp = 0.3
    kPch = p4
    
    kx = 0
    ky = 0
    krx = 0.5
    kry = 0.5
    krot = 1
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giCos, giSaw, giSquare
    
    ; Add resonance with comb filter
    aComb comb aTerr, 2, 1/kPch
    
    aMix = aTerr*0.6 + aComb*0.4
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

instr 7
    ; Terrain with waveguide resonator
    kAmp = 0.3
    kPch = p4
    
    ; Small, fast orbit
    kx = 0
    ky = 0
    krx = 0.2
    kry = 0.2
    krot = 3
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSine, giSaw, giSquare, giTri
    
    ; Pass through waveguide
    aRes wguide1 aTerr, kPch, 4000, 0.93
    
    aMix = aTerr*0.4 + aRes*0.6
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

instr 8
    ; Granular terrain texture
    kAmp = 0.25
    kPch = p4
    
    ; Random orbit jumps
    kTrig metro 8
    kx randh 0.6, 8, 0, 1
    ky randh 0.6, 8, 0, 1
    
    ; Random radii
    krx randh 0.3, 6, 0, 1
    krx = 0.3 + abs(krx)
    
    kry randh 0.3, 7, 0, 1
    kry = 0.3 + abs(kry)
    
    ; Variable rotation
    krot randh 1, 5, 0, 1
    krot = 1 + abs(krot)
    
    aTerr wterrain kAmp, kPch, kx, ky, krx, kry, krot, giSaw, giSquare, giTri, giPulse
    
    ; Envelope per grain
    kGrainEnv linseg 0, 0.01, 1, 0.08, 0.3, p3-0.09, 0
    
    outs aTerr*kGrainEnv, aTerr*kGrainEnv
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play timbral morphing
i1 0 4 220

; Play rhythmic modulation
i2 5 3 330

; Play chaotic terrain
i3 9 4 440

; Play stereo terrain
i4 14 4 392

; Play pitch tracking
; Format: start dur freq_start freq_end
i5 19 3 220 880
i5 22 3 880 220

; Play resonant terrain
i6 26 4 294

; Play with waveguide
i7 31 3 523
i7 34 3 440

; Play granular texture
i8 38 5 165

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>
